description:
Rather than create entirely new fields. This code can compute the specific angular momentum around a central point as before. However If there is a normal vector, the specific_angular_momentum_[xyz] fields are now in directions which are relative to that normal vector. This will go hand in hand with the particle_position_relative_[xyz] fields

Also fixes a few bugs in modify_reference_frame
title: [bugfix][improvement] Specific Angular Momentum [xyz] computed relative to a normal vector and some bug fixes

pullrequest.title: [bugfix][improvement] Specific Angular Momentum [xyz] computed relative to a normal vector and some bug fixes

content.raw: Specifically, the ordering here is important. Previously if the normal vector was [0., 0., 1.0 ] then the translation would not happen.
content.html: Specifically, the ordering here is important. Previously if the normal vector was [0., 0., 1.0 ] then the translation would not happen.

pullrequest.title: [bugfix][improvement] Specific Angular Momentum [xyz] computed relative to a normal vector and some bug fixes

content.raw: This is partly for optimisation, but also np.array([0, 0, -1.]) would also crash the code if it passed beyond this part of the code
content.html: This is partly for optimisation, but also np.array([0, 0, -1.]) would also crash the code if it passed beyond this part of the code

pullrequest.title: [bugfix][improvement] Specific Angular Momentum [xyz] computed relative to a normal vector and some bug fixes

content.raw:
This construction won't work, since `"code_length"` isn't in the default unit symbol look-up table.

Rather than using `YTArray` directly, it's usually safer use `data.ds.arr` in field definitions.  Alternatively, you can explicitly pass a unit registry to the `YTArray` initializer.
content.html:
This construction won't work, since "code_length" isn't in the default unit symbol look-up table.

Rather than using YTArray directly, it's usually safer use data.ds.arr in field definitions. Alternatively, you can explicitly pass a unit registry to the YTArray initializer.

content.raw: I added some additional testing support for particle fields in PR 1461, you may want to do a merge with PR 1461 so your new fields get tested. Don't commit your merge (only for testing purposes, and hopefully that PR will be merged into mainline soonish) since you don't want to to show up in the PR.
content.html: I added some additional testing support for particle fields in PR 1461, you may want to do a merge with PR 1461 so your new fields get tested. Don't commit your merge (only for testing purposes, and hopefully that PR will be merged into mainline soonish) since you don't want to to show up in the PR.

pullrequest.title: [bugfix][improvement] Specific Angular Momentum [xyz] computed relative to a normal vector and some bug fixes

content.raw: What @ngoldbaum meant is that you need to use idiom: `data.ds.arr(..., "code_length")`. `.arr` is pretty much the same thing as `YTArray`, but code units only make sense when they related to some dataset
content.html: What Nathan Goldbaum meant is that you need to use idiom: data.ds.arr(..., "code_length"). .arr is pretty much the same thing as YTArray, but code units only make sense when they related to some dataset
